conbody.p: T24 Basic plug-in editor differentiates a local file from a server file. Operations such as open, save, compile will be performed based on the nature of the file. The developer can identify a file in the editor as a local file or server file by looking at the image in the editor title.

li.p: A local file is a one which is either opened from a local project or saved to a local project. It will carry a local file image[see image above]. It is automatically saved to itâ€™s local path when saved [Ctrl+S or File>Save]. If it needs to be saved to another location locally, Save As Local File action has to be used. To save it in server, Save As Server File action has to be used.

When a file is saved to server or opened from server, it will be treated as a server file in editor. It will carry a server file image[see image above]. It is automatically saved to server in its original path [opened from or previously saved to] when saved [Ctrl+S or File>Save]. If it needs to be saved to another location in server, Save As Server File action has to be used. When saved with a different name, the original file will be closed in the editor and the newly saved file will be retrieved from server and opened in the editor. To save it locally, Save As Local File action has to be used.
